column1: 8/10 - Good job identifying the business function that could benefit from scrum/sprint methodology. However, the explanation could be more concise and focused on the specific benefits of scrum/sprint for that function. Keep up the good work!
10 pts - Some vagueness in description, but largely OK. Good effort in explaining the scrum/sprint methodology for mold development and kanban for production.

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit

Comment: Good attempt at explaining why Kanban is not the best fit for the function, but could be more specific about the poor fit aspects.

10 pts - You clearly identified the production function as the one that could benefit the most from implementing kanban methodologies. Great job explaining how kanban could operate for this function with a list of possible columns. Keep up the good work!

12 pts - Very complete and clear description of how kanban could operate. Great job explaining the benefits of kanban for the production stage and providing possible columns for the kanban board. Keep up the good work!

7 pts - Some vagueness or incompleteness in discussion of fit. 

Comment: Good attempt at explaining why scrum/sprint is not the best fit for the production stage, but could be more specific and clear in your explanation. Keep up the good work!

5 pts - Selected bias is clearly relevant to this situation.

Great job identifying confirmation bias as a potential issue in this decision-making process. Keep up the good work!

6 pts - Noticeable errors or misunderstanding in the definition. 

Your description of confirmation bias is somewhat unclear and could be more concise. Keep working on providing clear and accurate definitions.
12 pts - Complete and clear description of possible problem. Great job identifying the stages that could benefit from agile methodologies and providing detailed explanations. Keep up the good work!

10/10 - Excellent job! You provided a clear and complete description of the possible steps and actions for implementing the scrum/sprint and kanban methodologies in the appropriate stages of the process. Keep up the great work!
